resources.string: Signets are part of the endgame gearing in TSW that provide a proc effect or passive stat boost. They can be attached to a talisman or weapon with an <font color="#ff4444">[Empty Signet Slot]</font> in order to combine the effect with the item itself.

Signets are divided into three types: green, blue and purple. It takes ten identical green signets to form a blue signet of the same name and ten identical blue signets to form a purple signet.
(Note: you need 100 green signets with the same name to build one purple signet)
(Note: an overview of all available signets can be found in the <font color="#ff4444"> [App Main Menu] > [Signet Overview]</font>)

To attach a signet, place the item and the signet in the [Assembly Window] and click the [ASSEMBLE] button.
(Note: the item must be at full durability)
(Note: read the signet description as signets can only be attached to the item type specified there. Detailed description of each signet can be found in the [App Main Menu] > [Signet Overview])

If an item contains a signet you can overwrite it with a new one.
(Note: the old signet will be destroyed)
> CLOSE Where do I get Signets?

Signets cannot be crafted, but there are three possibilities to get signets:
> dropped by Nightmare and Lair mobs
(Note: drop rate is low)
(Note: the location of these mobs can be found in the [App Main Menu] > [Farming Locations])

> Quests
(Note: one [Signet Bag] as reward after completion; 68 hour cooldown)
(Note: which quests guarantee signets and their locations can be found in the [App Main Menu] > [Quests])

> B&D Bank or Ealdwic Post Office in London. [BUY] > [Upgrade(ItemType)] > [Signet(SubType)]
(Note: high prices)
"If you enjoy using this app, please take a moment to rate it. Thanks for your support!"
